#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk xorg-x11-drv-qxl
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: xorg-x11-drv-qxl bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The xorg-x11-drv-qxl package provides an X11 video driver for QEMU QXL video accelerator. This driver makes it possible to use Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 as a guest operating system under the KVM kernel module and the QEMU multi‑platform emulator, using the Simple Protocol for Computing Environments (SPICE). This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, when changing the screen resolution of a guest by resizing the remote‑viewer window, the mouse pointer in the guest disappeared. Consequently, the spice‑vdagent service had to be restarted to make the pointer visible again. With this update, the mouse pointer no longer disappears in this situation. (BZ#1030531) Prior to this update, the QXL driver, which does not support screen rotations, was trying to call the CrtcRotate function. As a consequence, the X.Org Server could terminate unexpectedly. To fix this bug, the QXL driver has been prevented from calling the CrtcRotate function. As a result, the X.Org Server no longer crashes. (BZ#1067709) Due to a bug, the guest display turned dark after switching to a very high resolution, which led to an error. Now, it is possible to successfully change screen resolution in the guest without any non‑standard behavior. (BZ#1127552) Users of xorg-x11-drv-qxl are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
